meanings.sent1: The dak delivers letters and packages in India.
meanings.sent2: I sent a letter through the dak to my friend in Mumbai.
meanings.sent3: The dak must be very busy during the holiday season.
meanings.sent4: The dak is like a silent messenger connecting people across the country.
meanings.sent5: The colorful dak van always catches my eye as it drives through the village.

meanings.definition: A type of drum used in South Asia.
meanings.sent1: The rhythmic beats of the dak filled the air during the festival.
meanings.sent2: The musician played the dak skillfully during the performance.
meanings.sent3: The dak drummers added an exciting energy to the celebration.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the dak echoed through the valley like a heartbeat.
meanings.sent5: The intricate designs on the dak drum were mesmerizing to watch as it was played.

meanings.definition: A type of fabric made from jute or hemp.
meanings.sent1: The traditional clothing was woven from soft dak fabric.
meanings.sent2: She sewed a beautiful dress using dak material.
meanings.sent3: The dak fabric felt rough but durable to the touch.
meanings.sent4: Her bag made of dak resembled a piece of nature itself.
meanings.sent5: The dak cloth had a natural earthy smell that reminded me of the outdoors.

meanings.sent1: I had to dak to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent2: The children love to dak around the playground during recess.
meanings.sent3: He tried to dak through the crowd to reach the front of the line.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel would dak up the tree trunk in a flash.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's feet seemed to dak effortlessly across the track during the race.
